Yes, here's a sample customer problem map for a Pinterest-like application:

| Problem | Customer Segment | Root Causes | Symptoms | Impact | Current Solutions |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Difficulty discovering new content | Content Consumers | Limited content recommendations based on trending topics | Boredom with the same content appearing frequently, difficulty finding content relevant to their interests | Decreased engagement with the platform, less time spent on the site | Using external search engines or manually browsing content to find new inspiration |
| Lack of visibility for influencer content | Influencers | Overcrowded platform with too much content | Difficulty getting their content seen by followers, limited reach | Decreased engagement with their followers, less brand visibility | Promoting their content through external channels or paying for increased visibility on the platform |

A customer problem map is a tool used to identify and understand the key problems faced by customers. In this sample, the customer problem map includes information about two customer segments: content consumers and influencers. By mapping out the root causes, symptoms, impact, and current solutions for each problem, the customer problem map provides a clear understanding of the key challenges faced by customers and helps inform product design and development decisions.
